website_summaries.verdict: Checks for nearly every measurement that matters. If you want the most comprehensive results, this is the one to get.
pros: This scale does it all: measures weight, body fat percentage, BMI, visceral fat, and other measurements
A great indicator of overall health
cons: Because it has so many features, it has a slight learning curve

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inaccurate bodyfat calculations
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of Omron products, mostly Blood Pressure Monitors, which I've checked vs my Dr's measurements and are accurate. This product gave me an accurate weight but a BF% of ~28% after several measurements. The high end machine at the gym I work out at gives me b/w 14 & 16% consistently (including today) and 28% would also put me well overweight, which I'm not by any stretch. The other measurements (& fact I have a legitimate 6-pack and am relatively muscular) illustrate the fact clearly it's way off. I suspect that the formula based on age, height, weight calculates averages (I'm 43, 5'9 & 190lbs) & drives more of the "measurement" than the actual measuring aspect.
customer_reviews.author: B-Ro

customer_reviews.title: This scale is incredibly accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scale for 4 years and I've always been curious about the accuracy. Today I went to get a Bodpod body composition analysis. It's considered to be one of the most accurate professional systems on the market. I tested my weight and body fat right before I left for the appointment. The scale's results were identical on weight and BMR to the Bodpod, and within 0.3% on body fat. Obviously your results may vary, but I'm confident that I'll never pay for a professional analysis again.
customer_reviews.author: James Wreck

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This product is truly junk. Believe the 1 star reviews. The two reasons I bought it were to get accurate weight and accurate body fat %. It cannot do either. I'm talking 2.5 pounds difference stepping on the scale, stepping off and stepping back on. I have used 7-site caliper measurement to calculate body fat which is very accurate but a pain to do alone. My measurements give me 19%, this scale gives me 29%. For the price, it should be kind of close. I'm returning this product and strongly recommend that everyone else save their money.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money
customer_reviews.text: Guys, once you start constantly seeing that "ERR" message, know that you're doomed if the 1 year warranty is up. They basically said I should throw it away. Its been basically two years since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindled Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weight measurements are completely inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Standing naked, calibrating, stepping on scale, reading weight. Repeat 6 times. Weight reading varies -+ 3 pounds. The least a scale can do is consistently weigh a naked person +- 1/2 pound in a single session. For $70, this is a joke. There’s no point evaluating the rest of the features. Garbage in (inaccurate weight), garbage out (all the digital hoo-hah) Utter piece of garbage. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Rob F

customer_reviews.title: Accurate scale and monitor - close to our Tanita numbers
customer_reviews.text: We have been on avery controlled/monitored diet through a nutritionist and they recommended this scale. Our program includes a high end Tanita scale and body composition analysis so we were eager to try this out side by side. It was surprisingly close to the Tanita numbers - close enough that we feel comfortable using this to watch our trends. It was easy to set up and it is easy to use. The only thing I would like to see is a way to export your daily numbers so it is easier to chart.
customer_reviews.author: Redhawk

customer_reviews.title: We loved this scale for the first few months
customer_reviews.text: We loved this scale for the first few months, then all the features quit except for the weight. It does great with weight but will not do any of the other measurements now. We have did all the troubleshooting to try and resolve this but nothing has worked! Going with a another brand, since we can't even find a way to get support from the Omron website or Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: I'm not returning the equitment because I'm from Paraguay, ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not returning the equitment because I'm from Paraguay, Latin America. and the shipping price exceeds the price of the equipment if I return it. The weight is correct in the measurement, but the other readings are not accurate. I have compared the readings with omron of other friends who have the same equitment and their readings mathc in each measure, but not with my omron. this thing even approaches with its readings throwing crazy values. The device shows very low values ​​of fat and very high biological age and visceral fat I clarify that I followed the instructions to use it according to the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Not precise measurements
customer_reviews.text: All the parameters are very imprecise. You can take 2 or 3 measurements in a row and they will all be different even for the weight measurement .
customer_reviews.author: George Narita

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate. Waste of time & money.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to have this. It was recommended via another website. I spent time reading the book & setting it up. It's totally inaccurate. I was exercising more, waist measurement getting smaller, clothes fitting more loose - Yet my body fat % was going up. It became like a game to see what percentage the scale decided I was that day. Ultimately it's a useless expensive scale.. so I sent it back. Amazon gave me a generous return window of like 8 weeks so I gave it a good run - but it's pure garbage. I have no idea how some people have a 5 star experience and then some of us have a 1...
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Compares favorably with nutritionist's clinical device. Repeated readings vary a little with cause.
customer_reviews.text: I find the Omron Body Composition Monitor to be a useful tool - daily weigh-in OK, but only for once-a-week full analysis. I have noticed its reported values vary +/- a few tenths between routines repeated within a few minutes of each other. Based on the literature and conversation with Omron Customer Service personnel, I expect that metal in a replaced knee joint and arm position instability may be culprits. In a recent side-by-side comparison with my nutritionist's clinical device, and though several of the analysis categories were not identical, those that could be parsed were reasonably close. So for me, it is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Kerkling

customer_reviews.title: Same measuremernt as the $6000 one at my Dr's office.
customer_reviews.text: Some people just can't handle the reality check. These are the same type of people that dismiss BMI and think they just naturally have as much muscle without routinely lift for years. If you are buying this to confirm a number that is already in your head then don't waste your money. Just keep in mind though that the only person you're fooling is yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how accurate it is, but testing indicates it has problems
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is good, quality is good for structure, but the accuracy is in question with those higher professional models in clinics, the results are too different. This scale tells me I am 10 years older than I am, and the one in the clinic tells me I am 3 years younger than I am. I think my fitness level and BMI is good, so I trust the clinic one more than this one. It is sad that Omron products are not of better accuracy. I don't trust this scale, the price was good, not cheap, but on par with others, but the accuracy is really in question, more testing needs to be done by other people.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy-to-use, well-designed
customer_reviews.text: Just a quick review here! I have you several scales like this one in the past and have had varying levels of success with them. This scale does an excellent job. It appears to be the most accurate of any of the ones I've seen. It also gives you visceral fat readings which many of them do not. Overall I have to say it is an excellent easy to use body composition scale. I certainly suggest getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Broken after one month. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually write reviews, but this product forces me to. I have had this for a little over 2 months. The first month has been good, i was able to track my weight BMI body fat etc. fairly well, the readings have been pretty consistent. I was by no means overweight, 150lbs male 5’10” by the way. Then one day, out of no where, the scale starts to show err messages whenever I turned it on, the few times I was able to use it, the reading has been way off the chart, ie. It reads that I was weighing 60lbs or sometimes lower. This is unacceptable, especially it’s by no means cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Zhang S.

customer_reviews.title: Mindblowing product
customer_reviews.text: I will recommend this scale blindly to anyone. The history feature for up to 4 sets is really complete and accurate. The indicators are everything you need to assess yourself in nutritional terms. I compared results with professional testings and they match by 95% I would say. The only measurement is not accurate I think, is the recommended calories intake, as it should vary for individuals based on needs. The building of the product itself is solid, really professional feel and look and the screen is clear. Indications are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad luck
customer_reviews.text: Defected product. The scale isn’t taking any measurements. I was able to power it up, set time and date, set my profile but after that nothing happens. It shows 0 on the scale but nothing happens when i step on the scale.
customer_reviews.author: M. ALYAHRI

customer_reviews.title: Great for general information.
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a great idea, in a nice package and simple to use but it’s not for the perfectionist. It does serve to establish general bench marks. I think some of the definitions could be better. The calorie explanation is confusing to me. The age indicator is suspect. I’ve lost 20 lbs, lost 5% body fat and gained 3% muscle but no change in Visceral fat or age. I’m 72, Fitbit says I’m in excellent shape for my age but your scale says 78. Doesn’t make sense. The history is good idea. The display is clear.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Effective health monitor
customer_reviews.text: Measures well, and had a function to save. Monitoring my home exercise and diet program results just became simpler!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: This weight scale, is very inconsistent with the results.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this weight scale it is very inconsistent with the results, and I always have to take the weight 2 or 3 times to match the weight given to me by my normal weight scale that I bought in a dollar store about 5 years ago, and that cost only $10.00 dollars. Neither is good or effective for athletes or for people building muscles like me. I bought this scale several months ago, and I am very disappointed with this purchase, because of the ineffectiveness of this weight scale. Sincerely, Josefa Jaimez.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely read the instructions and it measures 1/4 inches that gives more accuracy for measurements. I love it. It is astonishing to know how your muscle and fat percentages actually align with weight and health. Has visceral fat too. I have been using it daily to help measure my fat losses and muscle gains. I love it. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Find and Great Owners Manual!
customer_reviews.text: Best owners manual I've ever seen! All the measurements are described in depth and tables for of low to high ranges are given for different age groups. The only one that could use more detail is the "body age". Also a table is given to write down your results over dates. It is sized to be photo-copied and the photo-copies edited. So far the weight matches my old scale, which matches the doctor office scales. All the other results all make sense relative to what I know and have discussed with my doctor.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAnonymous  X.

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this scale.
customer_reviews.text: Weight seems to be pretty accurate, as is body fat and BMI. We haven't had any trouble with ours. Like one reviewer mentioned, when weighing yourself, turn the unit on, pick up the hand-held piece, but hold it so that the attached rope is slack. Otherwise, if you pull up on it while weighing, you will weigh lighter. Once the weight displays and blinks, you can hold it out in front of you to test the body fat, etc. At least, this is what works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Wiorks great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The readings are really close to the body mass machine at my doctor's office. It is very easy to use after reading the directions.
customer_reviews.author: FCar1999TA

customer_reviews.title: Wild ride
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, I figured with the additional hand grips it must be more accurate right? Well the weight is wildly inaccurate which throws a wrench in everything. I mean, literally you can step on this thing 6 times in a row, not change a thing, and get a different weight reading each time. And I’m not talking about a few tenths, it’s off by pounds. Crazy. Sending it back for a refund. Refund process has been super simple so that’s a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Has debris or loose plastic inside display and overweighs by 3 pounds
customer_reviews.text: This scale weighs me at three pounds more than the scale I am replacing and the scale at the gym. Maybe the other two scales are coincidentally wrong by the same amount, but then again, maybe it's this scale with the problem. The scale I received also has a piece of debris or loose plastic inside the display. It's very annoying, especially for what I spent on the product, and there doesn't appear to be a way to remove the debris/plastic without destroying the scale. So I get to be annoyed by it everyday when I weigh myself. The company really should do better quality control at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie Noel

customer_reviews.title: I like the viceral fat funtion
customer_reviews.text: This was a scale used at a Doctor's appointment I went to. I have that pesky visceral fat, and this scale has a function to measure that!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dwayne Dietert

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Since getting this a few days ago... I am measuring a whole percentage more in body fat every day. I am now at 23% according to the scale. There is NO way I am at 23% body fat. My abs are clearly visible and about to pop. Using comparison photos from a google image search I am likely near 15%. I don't think this thing differentiates very well between muscle and fat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps me tracking my weight, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It really helps me tracking my weight, fat percentage , it tells me my physical age and Recomend calorie , Visceral fat, BMI and muscle. I use it since November last year, lost 25 lbs, and 10years younger with healthy eating and exercise. For sure this composition scale really helped. worth the price !
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No wife or app, not easy to keep track!
customer_reviews.text: Pros - good to see your overall wellbeing -bmi, weight, fat, muscle, rest calories, body age and visceral fat is calculated - good to motivate yourself Cons - no wireless connection or application, it is not easy to keep track of your trend ( it has memory but the display is very limited and boring) - felt to me an algorithm works behing rather than an actual calculation ( not sure) - i feel it is home version of simplified pro equipment
customer_reviews.author: Onr

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: First I like that it works. Because I'm not medically trained, or a nutritionist, so I cannot speak for the accuracy of some of the settings. But, you will get results using it if you want to chart your progress. It won't lie to you, and you can see history to know if you're achieving your goal. Now, it's not the prettiest thing, but then does it have to be? So if you want a good scale with the functionality you desire in this product, you'll get your monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: W. D

customer_reviews.title: so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I could be wrong about this, but I have used this scale for 7 months now and have noticed on very distinct pattern weight goes down (even by ounces) muscle % goes down, fat % up. Weight goes up muscle % goes up, fat % goes down. Yes I know muscle weighs more then fat but I have been working with a trainer for 2 months now I have noticed a difference in my clothes, and measurements, yet the scale shows the same trend
customer_reviews.author: 2broken4u

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend this scale.
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day like an addict. I've had it for going on 2 years now and only changed the battery 1 time. Durable. Withstands my preschooler dragging it around the bathroom by the handles and stretching the cord that goes right back to normal size. Easy to clean and looks nice. Great for monitoring your muscle, visceral fat and body fat. Helps me when I'm trying new strategies with exercise and diet to see if what I'm doing is eating at my muscle or helping to build it. If this one broke which I don't see happening any time soon, I'd buy it again. Very happy with it. My mom and brother also have this scale.
customer_reviews.author: HappyLife

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scale. Seems very consistent as log as you follow instructions. Only missing feature is bluetooth to use with my Samsung note 8, other than that Omron is a very reputable manufacturer. If you don't need the smartphone connection go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar H. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid reliable and great information
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a number of similar scales that would start giving me wildly low readings. I don't know why they can't get the basic electronics right. This Omron is completely free of those problems. Its sensors are able to give important information on one's fat distribution---- visceral fat, BMI, and %fat. It gives the same reading from repetitions, and from one scale to the next. I am especially happy when it tell me my body age is 7 years less than my real age (on a good day!).
customer_reviews.author: A techno geek

customer_reviews.title: No compensation for holding the bar? What?
customer_reviews.text: You zero the scale, and weigh yourself... okay. You take the handle out, zero the scale, then weigh and measure yourself... weight is 1+ pounds heavier... oh, it's the bar. They know how much the bar weighs... you mean they can't compensate for that weight? Worse (for the physicists out there), the bar is *spring*-connected... the taller you are, the more you *lift* the bar (and thus *add weight*!). Just brain-dead! Okay, so the measurements are helpful... but I have to question a company missing this obvious problem... and the fact that my nutritionist has the exact same scale and gets different numbers (fraction-3 pounds different). Will try to find a more reliable scale myself.
customer_reviews.author: Randy D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Need to get hang on it
customer_reviews.text: I like this scale but not it is not able to connect to my phone. And the cord is very annoying. It adds a pound or so to ky weight if i am holding the body fat measuring device up. At first I kept thinking why my weight was going back and forth then i realized each time i held up the device, i got heavier. So i must weight myself without the handheld if i want an accurate number.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Y. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I started a weight loss plan about 3 months ago and use this to track progress. My body fat readings vary a percent or so throughout the day but it's always consistent with the variance. I started around ~22% and am now down to ~14%. It took me a second to accept that I was that overweight, probably a driver for some of these negative reviews, but once you make progress it feels great and makes sense. Weight is accurate too and BMI is just simple math it does for you. I really like the 90 day memory as well. For the price, you'd be hard pressed to find better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY what I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Yeesss finally! this is what i've been looking for for ages. Tells you BMI, weight, visceral fat, fat%, body age, etc. So helpful and motivating for my diet and exercise routine. Especially since I'm a visual person. Trying to gain muscle and lose fat is a slow process, you don't see it easily (because you see yourself every day so the subtle change isn't visible to you)- however, the scale helps you to see how the numbers are changing and how your diet and exercise are actually effecting your body fat, muscle, bone % etc
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Ego booster
customer_reviews.text: I like that it saves your information in it. Seems pretty accurate. I’m still not 100% convinced that this can actually read your BMI, visceral fat, muscle %, fat %, Resting metabolism and body age. I’m a 42 year old woman and when it tells me my body age is 21 It gives me a confidence boost. Hahaha So, I choose to believe it! Lol! When ever I need a boost I get on my scale and tells me I’m less than half my actual age. Really hope it’s accurate. If anything, it is a good scale for overall body weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Martin

customer_reviews.title: If you just weigh yourself and not hold the body comp thing it's an easy 2lbs lighter
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this scale is that it's inconsistent. If you pick up the body comp calculator and also weigh yourself the scale will be 2lbs heavier. If you just weigh yourself and not hold the body comp thing it's an easy 2lbs lighter. They need to figure that out. Maybe a wireless component should be built in the next iteration.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This scale is Bluetooth ready and Omron is a great brand. We purchased it because we have other Omron products and this scale has an APP that keeps tracks of our progress so we can provide our Doctor with the information. It's design is slim and with limited space in our bathroom it fits well due to its slim size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the different readings and profiles.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scale I could find. I searched high and low for a good body fat scale that wouldn't completely break the bank. Although I do wish it was cheaper, I really do like it. I love that you can have four different profiles on it. My friends and I use it to track our progress at the gym. I think all of the different readings are really nice as well. If you have the money to spend, I definitely recommend this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WORKED THE FIRST TINE, BUT MISSING ONE MEASUREMENT TOO
customer_reviews.text: The scale measured my weight, BMI, Belly fat, Muscle, kcal, Body Age. But it did not calculate or give my number for Visceral fat. The second time and subsequent times, using the scale, it only calculated/ gave me my weight, but no other numbers/values. Unfortunately, I threw out the shipping box, so I guess that I'll just have to keep this scale as a secondary scale. I have an old Doctor's scale from a retired Doctor. I bought this scale in order to calculate how much fat and muscle and ultimately lean tissue that I have and will gain while restarting weight lifting. I already know how much I weigh, from the Doctor's scale that I have inside my house.
customer_reviews.author: John 2517

customer_reviews.title: Love it and the details it gives!
customer_reviews.text: I overall love this scale! I was fond of it after a class I was in for balancing blood sugar and eating properly used it in tracking our body fat/BMI/muscle/visceral fat. The only thing I have noticed is that it's not keeping the memory. I am going to switch out the batteries and see if that may be the issue. Other than that I write down my results each time.
customer_reviews.author: Kim F. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: My trainer does my body comp twice a month. I bought this Omron scale so I could check at home, too. The body fat percentage, however, is drastically higher than it is in reality. I had my husband try it, and it was the same scenario. Example: I have 11.5% BF, but the scale read 26-29%. My husband has 8% BF, but the scale read 22-24%. The batteries were new, we were standing properly, holding the handles properly, and followed the directions explicitly. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated the fat percentage is too inaccurate, i don't even bother to use it for that anymore. It also seems to round weight towards specific increments. It claimed I was around 28% when an actual body composition test showed me closer to 20%. Depending on the weight, it might be a fraction of a pound or a half off, so it could weigh you up to a pound more or less than you are. Just seems like a lot of money for a gimmick scale.
customer_reviews.author: ClaytonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend with this scale who said it was fantastic. I was a bit skeptical about spending so much on a scale. When I received it.. it was great was accurate and did not give different readings stepping on and off the scale. 18 months in.. the scale just won't turn on. I figured the batteries were dead. I changed the batteries. Nope still dead. Contact customer support.. they said out of warranty period. Nothing seems to be built to last anymore. I will go back to just buying a cheapo scale that can be thrown out every year.
customer_reviews.author: Dreepa

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate readings, as many others have already said. I would weigh myself multiple times at once and my weight would fluctuate by 1-3 lbs. My body fat percentage also fluctuated between 33 and 35 within only a day. I am certainly not 33+. I am at a healthy weight and according to body fat photos online, I am more like a 25-26. It made sense to read other reviews saying the percentage was off by 5-10%. Unacceptable. I returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Thies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Accurate Measurement Tool For Anyone Wanting More Than Just Body Weight.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for monitoring the key components of body composition. No problem setting the monitor up but it did take me a few tries to understand how to utilize the personal measurement. With a little practice I had measurements and a starting point. I like the measurement log. I know that Omron is primarily in the medical measurement business but it would be really helpful if they would provide a more detailed explanation (or perhaps a resource or web link) into the meaning, impact and possible adjustments of BMI, Body Fat Percentage, Skeletal Muscle Percentage, Resting Metabolism, Body Age, and Visceral Fat. Also what sources they used for calculating the ranges for the measurements. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tigard Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: The memory function didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I received my Omron HBF-514C today. I set all my personal data in the personal profile number 1 without any problem. I made my first measurement and got all my results. However none of them were saved to the memory. I repeated the process 5 times and the results were never saved to the memory. Another concern is that my 15 year old daughter (saved on profile user 2) made her measurement and no values for muscle, RM, Body Age, and visceral fat were shown. I don’t know if we are doing something wrong or if the unit is damaged. I‘d appreciate some response from Omron representatives. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: LYNDA

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in hopes that i woukd be able to measure my body fat percentage and muscle mass. Went to a place that had a InBody scale and they are very accurate to get a feel of the difference between this scale. The weight was measured correctly but the body fat % there was a difference of almost 8% between the two scales and for the muscle mass there was a 20lbs difference. The weird thing is that many years ago a gym that I used to go had this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, fairly accurate with a memory feature to remember your stats
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to use. Love the memory feature that lets you look at your stats from the previous weeks. Also, let's you create personal accounts for more than one person. The weight measurements are quite accurate. I can't say the same about body fat % measurements. Made 3 measurements 5 minutes apart without making any changes to myself. Each time the % increased by 0.5. Overall, a good and convenient product to have in the house
customer_reviews.author: Shashank Sanjay

customer_reviews.title: ERR4
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work; keeps getting Error 4; sating I haven't put the right numbers in for calculation. Talked with Omron Health corp and was told no more than the manual which is that you haven't put the correct height, sex, and age in. And when i disproved that she said: send it back.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Inbody/DEXA (which is the gold standard of accuracy) and tape measure via body calculator websites give a consistent measurement to each other which is nearly 1.8x what this scale is showing and lines up "visually" with expectations of body fat. I don't know what to say. I'm hoping that the scale is at least "directionally" correct over time, even if that's the case it's still a useful tool. The weight itself seems accurately.
customer_reviews.author: hb-497

customer_reviews.title: One of the best I've owned and great features
customer_reviews.text: Solid scale which I have tested against others. It lives up to it's expectations and with the profile history I don't need it to be WiFi BT. Make sure like past posters have mentioned to tap it on and wait for calibration before picking up the handle.
customer_reviews.author: IammE

customer_reviews.title: Scale works good. Not so sure body fat measurement is accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The scale portion works really well. I'm not convinced that the body fat measurement system is all that accurate ... and the body fat system was the reason I picked this scale in the first place. The body fat system tells me that I am at 18% body fat, but when I use the $5,000 scale at Lifetime, it tells me that I am at 12%. Considering I have a decent six pack, I'm inclined to believe that the 12% number is more accurate. I'm keeping it ... just a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad scale. Just hear to use and track your date
customer_reviews.text: As a scale it did service it purpose. However it’s almost 2020. It’s need mobile app to track your daily or weekly date. Also it’s not user friendly. For it’s price I will recommend other smart scale. Not a bad scale. Just hear to use and track your date
customer_reviews.author: joe lee

customer_reviews.title: Provides useful feedback while building muscle and/or losing fat
customer_reviews.text: I like that this scale tells much more than just my weight. Getting a good idea of how much of my weight is muscle and how much is fat lets me see better what kind of results I'm getting as I work on improving my physical condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I just can't trust this scale. My belly has shrunk 2 inches and my lifts continue to increase, but my body fat refuses to change and even goes up while my muscle % goes down? It must have trouble deciding what's muscle and what's fat. I'd recommend it for general weight...but even then I noticed I have to pop the sensor off to get an accurate reading, it changes the weight by about .6 lbs if you leave it in.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Francis

customer_reviews.title: not accurate or consistent
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. The weight is off by .2-.4 pounds every time. Even when The weight is exactly the same on both scales, the body composition is totally different. The numbers are not even close. My body fat is 6% higher on 1 scale!
customer_reviews.author: rqMD

customer_reviews.title: Consistent, reliable information for serious athletes
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scale for more than two years now. It provides very consistent and very accurate information. Particularly for body fat measurements, it provides very good accuracy when benchmarked against more time-consuming measurements. When compared to scales that do not provide for multi-source input for impedence measurements (that is, scales where you just stand on two conductive plates to estimate body composition), the accuracy is hugely better. The scale is easy to set up and use, and it reports information clearly. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D. Gesch

customer_reviews.title: It works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it works perfectly. If you dont want to see what your body is really made of...then dont buy it. As far as I can tell...it gave me almost the exact same readings as the one at the doctors office..which I'm sure had a few more zeros on the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed at this machine the reading is off each morning I take three times a few seconds apart and every reading has a big difference in gap! How can that be? it’s a overpriced machine, not worth it
customer_reviews.author: j.ho

customer_reviews.title: Very nice scale and great addition to fitness enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scale and great addition to fitness enthusiasts. Inconsistent readings are caused mostly because people does not read instructions. It clearly says that you should not measure when water content is changed, i.e. when you eat or drink water, or take a shower. Also, you should keep in mind that generally such scales are not recommended for people with high muscle content, because it causes incorrect readings. The best thing for such scales is to measure yourself at the same conditions, e.g. in the morning when you get up. This way the reading will be consistent and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ivane Narimanidze

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to aid in my "Unfattening"
customer_reviews.text: I started getting fat to the point of imploding into myself like a neutron star so I bought this scale to track my weight loss. It is very accurate and I like hos you get other bodily stats other than weight so it helps you track your progress.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tron

customer_reviews.title: I practice daily and it just works
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a year already with regular physical activity. The calibration of this tool is perfect, I can see my progress every morning. Very sensitive to muscle and fat percentages. If you want to loose weight, use this tool, it will guide you in right direction.
customer_reviews.author: Dzianis Zhauenrchyk

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent product, measures more parameters than other ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent product, measures more parameters than other scales. However I'm not sure how accurate it is. It measures my weight 3 lbs heavier than the Wii Fit balance board I've been using for 5+ years. I have another hand held Omron body fat monitor, and this scale also measures that about 3% higher than the hand held monitor.
customer_reviews.author: heatherbree23

customer_reviews.title: Health and fitness monitoring tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good smart scale to get your necessary fitness data. It is much better than your regular digital scale. But it is not accurate to provide the physiological age because that is mainly based on the weight. If you are slim, the scale may give you a physiological age of 18 even though you are over 40.
customer_reviews.author: xumamazon

customer_reviews.title: An accurate BMI instead of a math formula!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I began a ketogenic lifestyle after the first of the year when the bathroom scale hit an all time high!! I wanted to track my BMI with electrical impedance because one math formula does not fit all! It gives me five body measurements that I have on an electronic spreadsheet where I can accurately track my progress. The good news?? We are three weeks into the year and I am down 15 pounds so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline R.

customer_reviews.title: Good scale and other functions are mediocre.
customer_reviews.text: It is an accurate scale. Not sure about the other readings as they seem to spike sometimes without cause but the body fat% matches other similar machines at my gym. The memory function is good to help see your progress. I wouldn't buy this for the body age function. I'm not sure what metrics or criteria it uses to judge your body age but it says I am more than twice my actual age though I exercise 6 days a week, run for 40 minutes at an 8 minute mile pace, drink moderately no more than twice a week, and eat mostly lean meats, vegetables, and whole grains.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to other trainers
customer_reviews.text: I am a personal trainer and I use this with my clients to track progress. We all know these portable BIA machines are not 100% accurate, so what I usually look for is precision. Does the machine give you an answer within 0.3% for subsequent reading performed within 3 minutes? The answer for this device is yes. I have found the Omron to give very consistent readings and it has proved suitable for tracking my clients' progress. I would recommend this product to other trainers. I would definitely recommend buying the carrying case, though, as this does not come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Weight good, all else bad.
customer_reviews.text: Weight is accurate. Easy to use. The handheld portion to measure body fat and other options on the hand held stopped working after about 60 days approximately. Feel sort if ripped off si cell that is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Rice

customer_reviews.title: Not at all accurate
customer_reviews.text: I stood on scale 10 times and got 10 different body fat readings. Weight, BMI, etc were all the same but thru a two day period 10 different percentages on body fat from 10.3-12.9. No way I can trust accuracy of this for this price.
customer_reviews.author: R Mills

customer_reviews.title: Far from quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice.. honestly just a calculator with two cheap devices combined into one cheap device.. Anyway Reason for 3 out of 5 is that memory feature isn't working at all.. It doesn't save my measurements and user manual doesn't have an answer. I will be calling them on my next day off. Update: So idk how but the memory just kicked in variables are somewhat consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Amshei

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: My unit is a defected unit, 4 AA batteries only lasted for 3 months or so. I contacted Omron customer service and they said I should send my unit for inspection. That was 3 weeks ago; i haven’t heard anything from them. I followed up once, they said their inspection department was behind schedule (they said it would take 5 business days to inspect the unit ). Long story short, if you buy a good unit, everything is good. But, if you unfortunately buy a defected unit like me, the Omron customer service doesn’t really help you with this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Ling-Fang Tseng

customer_reviews.title: I recently joined a weight loss challenge and they used this scale so it was super helpful to have one at home too
customer_reviews.text: Still using this 2 years later and still just as happy. Much more than just a scale. Really helps you see how your body is changing as you diet/exercise. I recently joined a weight loss challenge and they used this scale so it was super helpful to have one at home too. Memory feature lets you see your progress.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Dressler

customer_reviews.title: WAY Better than a normal scale!
customer_reviews.text: I've used one of these for several years, and used it while I have lost a considerable amount of weight. I misplaced mine in my last move, and it's in a box somewhere... So I bought another. While I wouldn't say the numbers are totally accurate ( the weight part is!), it is valuable for the trend and comparison. For example, I think it reads high on bodyfat percentages, but once you have a baseline, I think it's accurate for the CHANGE of bodyfat. Also throw the "body age" number out the window, it says I'm 80 years old! lol! WHAT??? And I'm very fit! Maybe it knows something I don't?? But overall a great scale.
customer_reviews.author: SkyGodSam

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scale. It was priced great and I received it quickly. I like the look of it and the digital screen is easy to read. It's well made and durable. I use it every day to track my fitness. It has a bunch of great features which are very useful when tracking your progress during a weight lose program. I wish it had a rechargeable battery rather then having to buy disposable batteries. Other then that I have no complaints about this buy. I recommend this scale to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Tueros

customer_reviews.title: Best body composition scale hands down! Period!
customer_reviews.text: Best body composition weight scale I have ever bought. It beats even the newest more sophisticated WiFi enabled scales by tenfolds! I’ve had this for 10 years now and it’s still working like new.
customer_reviews.author: MLZ

customer_reviews.title: No need to look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a new scale, not that this product hasn't been great ~ but honestly, after 9.5 years it STILL works GREAT!!! Its accuracy is comparable to professional medical products, AND at a great price. I've used it in support of training for Everest data stats, TWICE; and I have been very pleased with its accuracy & features. Seldom ever do I get the ERR error message; AND now, there is really NO need for me to buy any other product, YET ~ again, after nearly 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: andre

customer_reviews.title: Wrong data input in the app
customer_reviews.text: I just bought one of your weigh product and found something wrong: In my history dash, fat ration number used as BMI number. (See the attachment) I have to consider returning it if it can be put into data so wrong... Anyone give me an explanation or I should return it?
customer_reviews.author: Jeniffer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it is very accurate. First time using this scale, it's very easy to learn how to use it, I love that it comes with a manual that explains exactly everything. Batteries are included.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia-M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get it.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked once. One week later when I weighed myself it only gives the lbs weight and all of the other measurements like body fat, muscle percentage, etc do NOT work. I tried it multiple times and even saved the weight to see if I could see the other measurements under the “memories” and it doesn’t save it. It also reset my personal information like age, height, etc after the first use. If I wanted a regular scale that can only tell me one thing I would’ve just bought a regular one. So disappointing. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Maria E. Villalva

customer_reviews.title: Bio-impedance too imprecise for us
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to like this scale but the bio-impedance readings are far too imprecise to be useful. Under the recommended conditions, I was getting readings 4-5% apart from one day to the next. Sometimes 2% apart if I repeat the scan 30 seconds later.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: No WiFi Bluetooth or Phone App
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid closer attention - so I take full responsibility, but a product this technical and new should have bluetooth and/or wifi with compatible apps for your phone - and it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dankers

customer_reviews.title: Best Scale on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the accuracy of this scale. Extremely sensitive almost to a fault. In fact if you try to weigh yourself on a slightly carpeted surface the reading will be completely off. You must weigh yourself on a completely level hard floor white barefoot. I love how you can monitor your progress on a daily basis. Set up is a little complicated but not too bad. Just be sure to follow the instructions exactly as they are in the instruction manual. And if you get confused a customer service number is provided. The customer service is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: mgk

customer_reviews.title: Must have to regain your health
customer_reviews.text: This scale has many features to monitor toward leading a healthy life style other than just weight. You can monitor your body fat, body age, and skeletal muscle percentages just like a personal trainer would in helping you to be healthy. I am loving this scale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good at first. Didn't last a year.
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it wasn't. Not used to a scale breaking this quickly. Great product but no longevity. Apparently this review is being hidden by a sensitivity filter. Unsure as to why - it is just a scale...
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The weight portion of the scale is spot on but the body fat percentage is way off. For example my body fat normally ranges 19/20% (based on gym and hospital checks) the first time I used the scale it said 27% body fat. I had not gained any weight since I had previously checked and I do a ton of lifting and running every week. 7-10 hours min. My body fat did not jump up 7% when my diet is perfect; and looking at my body I’m gaining definition. It may work as a tool to monitor but I would not rely heavily on the other functions such as body fat.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for becoming and staying healthy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine. In efforts to get healthy, I decided to make an investment in my health. With this equipment i am able to track my weight, my BMI, body fat, muscle, how many calories I should eat daily, body age and visceral fat. It has allowed me and my family to take control of our weight and finally become informed in our overall health not just our weight. After becoming familiar and understanding the numbers, it encourages you to make the necessary changes to get healthy and improve your numbers! I am definitely pleased and would recommend this product. This was recommended to me. I am quite satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase it, it waste batteries
customer_reviews.text: The new fresh four Energizer batteries can not keep working for two weeks. It should have some short circuit issue inside but assistant of Omron still claimed it was no issue and refused to support me, but ask me to purchase new fresh batteries. TRASH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chen L.

customer_reviews.title: Great scale
customer_reviews.text: Love this scale! Only thing I dislike is where the on/off button is because where I store it, it’s easy to hit the button unintentionally and turn on causing the battery to die quicker. But I’m sure for others, they love how convenient the power button is and think differently! It shows body fat and muscle mass which is my favorite part of this scale
customer_reviews.author: Jaden Nordin

customer_reviews.title: Highly inaccurate readings
customer_reviews.text: The weight on the scale seems to work fine but if you want to track BMI, Body fat and muscle percentage, don't buy this device. It doesn't give accurate results. I just returned it as for a half the price you could get a decent scale.
customer_reviews.author: Moises Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble finding a handheld Bioelectrical Impedance machine, then I saw this, so I figured I would give it a try. I'm upset that I'm out side of my return window, because this thing is useless. None are truly accurate but this one is so far off it's laughable. The scale portion is fine, but I could have saved about $50 and just purchased a regular scale if that's what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Accurate scale
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor although I argue with it frequently :-). It is accurate compared to the scale in my doctor's office. I can't comment fully on the body composition yet, but it seems accurate. Easy to use. I prefer this over other similar monitors, including the Aria scale.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't measure the right weight
customer_reviews.text: The scale doesn't work right. I have another scale and this Omrom one is always with 4kg less and the body fat percentage is completely different.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Doesn't work. Doesn't zero out on scale, doesn't read anything as its advertised. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: sayhar84

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: This does not work! It only measured weight and would never measure composition. I even called Omron and they could not find their manual but told me one employee thought you had to wait 24 hrs before the memory recorded info. I waited and it still didn’t work. When you first turn it on the year 2008 flashes. You can tell it’s outdated. We own their blood pressure monitors and they are very reliable; however this is not!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as Tanita scale
customer_reviews.text: I used a Tanita scale for years and years. When I finally had to retire my trusty Tanita scale, I did not see any new one from Tania that I liked. Only other company I thought I would turned to for this type of projects was Omron. It did not betray that expectation. It is easy to use, display is easy to see, and it gives me more than enough features and information I need about my body! Memory and record features are very nice and convenient especially if you want to monitor your data very closely and consistently. I use it every morning and I believe it's proven that it is very accurate a for home-use scale.
customer_reviews.author: Koko O

product_meta.title: Omron Body Composition Monitor with Scale - 7 Fitness Indicators & 180-Day Memory
product_meta.description: Style:180-Day Memory TrackerOmron’s full body composition monitors are unlike any other fitness measurement devices available. The breakthrough design is clinically proven to be just as accurate as much more expensive methods used by physicians and other health professionals. By utilizing advanced sensors, you get a precise reading quickly in the comfort of your own home.
feature_bullets: Measures 7 different fitness indicators: Body fat percentage, BMI, skeletal muscle, resting metabolism, visceral fat, body age, and weight
Accurately measures body fat percentage using proven bioelectrical impedance method
Easy to read digital screen displays body weight up to 330 pounds in seconds. Recommended to take the measurement in the morning before exercise, eat, drink or take a shower
Stores up to 4 individual profile settings so the whole family can track their progress with 90 days of memory
Retractable cord makes it suitable for adult users up to 6’ 6 3/4” Tall if the weight value is displayed abnormally low orhigh then place the monitor on a hard and level floor

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
